annotations.caption: Fig. 1. The coefficient of Pe2 in the small-Pe optimal enhancement (32) with n = 1 (first zero). The optimal enhancement is achieved for m = 2, then drops off slowly.
annotations.caption_no_index: The coefficient of Pe2 in the small-Pe optimal enhancement (32) with n =  (first zero). The optimal enhancement is achieved for m = 2, then drops off slowly.
paragraph: Since j m,n increases monotonically with n, we must take n = 1 to minimize T . Thus the optimal streamlines pattern displays a single cell in the radial direction. It is then a simple matter of enumerating the zeros j m,1 to find that the integrated mean exit time is minimized for (m, n) = (2, 1), independent of the Péclet number (see Figure 1). The streamline and mean exit time patterns are illustrated in Figure 2.
